data.title: Add damage debug overlay
data.body: Balancing as well as debugging damage-related new features would be easier if we had a debug option for displaying damage (functionally similar to the display of bounties for a killed unit, but displaying the damage an actor received).

data.title: AttributeModifier and Manager added.
data.body:
Allows modifiers to be defined per player and per actor.
Modifiers can define prerequisites.
Currently supports production and income.

Allows for tie-in from HackyAI. InsaneAI for RA included.

Pre-work for #6103.

```
21:24 < kilU> I think I found a bug - if the nod aircraft is above wall, he 
              lose own energy and bullets dont go to enemy just stop on wall 
21:25 <+pchote> interesting

21:25 < kilU> from air?

21:25 <+pchote> which it really should be
```

data.title: Regression: Oberserver UI, Power countdown hidden under options & statistics buttons
data.body:
The very top-most of the globally displayed countdown timers (GPS / Nuke) is hidden under the options and statistics buttons.

In this image: http://s10.postimg.org/rqn8wo915/Error01.png you can see Yellow has a nuke, but its countdown is displayed under the buttons. (You can barely make out a single slither of yellow of the countdown).

data.title: Customized restricted units / allowed units list?
data.body:
I noticed these new features which allows different tech levels to be used.

However, most of the people dont really like those, since they lack some interesting units.

It would be nice - for example - if you could build ALL infantry in the low tech mode; you could build tech center to be able to build Tanyas etc.

Basically what i am suggesting, is to allow the game to read a file which has list of unitnames which will be allowed; everything else will not be allowed. That way it would be easy to create these minimodes for any map and have some extra fun with different settings.

The file could simply consist of lines such as:

```
My funny minimod
rifleman
rocketman
lighttank
harvester
barracks
refinery
powerplant
```

Which is very easy to read and write by anyone, including machines and humans.

First line = minimod name (visible in the game room for everyone). You could therefore save these minimod files into some folder and use them later on any map, and other players could be able to browse the list in game room to see which units are enabled so they can prepare for the game.

data.title: 6066 Crate Prerequisites
data.body:
Closes  #6066, #2587.

Also updated crate yaml for affected mods (RA and D2K).

Also adds YamlException on a GiveUnitCrateAction if it does not define any units to give.

data.title: Log reason why a Lua script fails to parse
data.body:
Explains more why the script failed parsing. Also adds a `Game.AddChatLine` for why it fails.

![luaparseerror2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566742/3822375/9de3891a-1d23-11e4-9dd3-069e767ce7c0.png)

data.title: Option for technology researching or default effects in mods
data.body:
In some RTS games (such as Age of Empires 2 or C&C Generals), some buildings provide "Research" icons, which when paid for and the build is completed, it does something like improve firing rate or horde bonus or increased vision range, etc.

I know none of the given mods will need it, because each building planted makes the tech tree grow, but I think this would be a neat option for anyone who wants to make a mod featuring this effect.

What I mean by default effects... Units of a faction will have some kind of improvement by default because of that faction. Like how CC:Generals the Chinese have the horde bonus, or how the factions in RA1 have different armor/power values even though they share the same e1, etc.

data.title: Asset downloader polish
data.body:
The download progress window should:
- have thousands separator so it's easier to read (98,000 or 98 000 instead of 98000)
- the size text should be aligned to the right so it doesn't vibrate as the downloaded number changes
- use [KiB](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kibibyte) (1024 bytes) instead of kB (1000 bytes)

data.title: AA and Sam site should face their targets only when they're within range
data.body:
They seem to follow enemy aircraft far beyond their range. But not always, I haven't tested it but in the early game they seem to face aircraft anywhere on the map.

data.title: Beacons for paratroopers and parabombs never disappear when the badgers get shot down
data.body: Their beacon timers get frozen before they arrive and the beacons just stay there for the entire game.

data.title: #6177: Fix for 6030 upgrade rules
data.body:
Updated UpgradeRules to correct regressions caused in yaml.
- Fixed the incorrect double entry size for HealthPercentage and PerCell warheads.
- Fixed ValidTargets and InvalidTargets not being propagated from Weapon to Warheads. (Causing most weapons to damage passing airplanes and such nonsense).

Closes #6177.
Closes #6222.
Closes #6240.
Closes #6245.

data.title: Fix observer widgets not showing up when a player loses
data.body: Fixes #6172.

data.title: Converting mod to new Release
data.body:
Hi guys, I've just downloaded the new release. And I must say, there is some pretty damn neat functionality! Naturally. I need to bring my mod forward onto this new platform and take advantage of all the new features! Before I even think about releasing it to the community. So, I read through a guide how to use Window's command line interface. And couldn't manage to open the utility to make my mod compatible with the new release.

I'm running a 64-bit, Windows 7. With OpenRA installed to my X86 program files. Could you guys help me out with this please? I'd greatly appreciate it.

data.title: Amphibious Infantry
data.body:
Is there a way to make units (infantry and vehicle) respond with different animation sequences and other rulesets if I wanted to make them amphibious? Similar to the SEALs and Tanya in Red Alert 2.

Like for example, infantry can stand, shoot, die, etc, but I see those are names that belong to a specific set of frames in the .shp file, as defined in the sequence file. What would I do to make it the case for units in the water? water-stand, water-move, water-die, etc. (given the frames)

Also to allow the option for units to go into stealth when in the water to simulate going underwater, and not stealth when on land, or just be completely visible?
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3558307-amphibious-infantry?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Add a GIF parser
data.body:
Include a GIF parser in the OpenRA system for the image format that can replace .shp files, the same way we can use for sounds/music the .wav and .ogg files to replace the .aud files.

This will make a format that doesn't rely on another program to specifically break down the .shp, and it will allow for most photo-editing programs to work on images/frames much more directly.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/3557793-add-a-gif-parser?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Allow transporting helicopter units to stay hovering, and land on command instead.
data.body:
I had made a mod unit of a helicopter that functioned like a flying pillbox. However, everywhere I sent it, it kept landing; leaving it open to enemy ground units instead of just anti-air.

I suggest making it so transport helicopters stay afloat until I "deploy" it to land and then disembark the troops, and stay on the ground until the next "move" command call to lift off and move over.

data.title: #6030 Regression from UpgradeRules
data.body:
While doing #6162 I noticed that I had made a mistake in my UpgradeRules for `HealthPercentageDamageWarhead`.
Previously they did not support `int[] Size` (more accurately, they ignored the second parameter), while now they are allowed to support it.
I had put into the upgrade rules that it apply both entries of the size when splitting out a `HealthPercentageDamageWarhead` if two entries had existed for the weapon before.
This breaks the MadTank, which used the two entries for the smudges, rather than the weapon area of effect.

I'll fix the UpgradeRules tonight, double check if I had made the same mistake for `PerCellDamageWarhead` and upload the updated weapons.yaml for all 4 mods.

data.title: Mechanic repair range ignored or miscalculated.
data.body:
- Flew Yaks into enemy's base to receive some damage
- Yaks returned to airfields where I had mechanics waiting
- Wrench audio + repairs began as expected
- Before full-repair I ordered the Yaks to ~20 cells away
- Audio and repairs persisted

data.title: AutoTarget ignores Building actors.
data.body:
Closes #6170 and addresses:

```
[23:22:22]  <pchote> units should only auto-target units
[23:22:27]  <Phrohdoh> why?
[23:22:35]  <pchote> that is how the original games worked 
```

If there is a better way to check caller type let me know and I'll implement it.

data.title: Space to beacon in replays
data.body: Its not working with space in replays..

data.title: Implement IMA ADPCM WAV file support
data.body:
Fixes #4628.

Unfortunately it seems @jamslater lost interest or is otherwise not able to continue working on it at the moment, so I'm trying to bring this into a "good enough" state so we finally have an alternative to AUD with both compression and stereo support.

Code is pretty much @jamslater's work, I just rebased and tried to adress at least a few of @ScottNZ's style nits.
I'll need more specific examples for further improvements in that regard.

data.title: Show lobby information in diplomacy menu
data.body:
Show the info about map name, size, game settings during gameplay. Diplomacy menu seems to be the most appropriate place since it already has player/team info. Even the minimap that's shown in lobby should be available in the game. Maybe this could be a tab called lobby settings or match settings.

data.title: Allied units shouldn't attack a building which is being captured
data.body: Allied units shouldn't attack a building if an engineer is in the process of capturing it.

data.title: #6030 Regression fix: CreateEffectWarhead
data.body:
CreateEffectWarhead effect location and water impact sound.

Closes #6164, #6165.

Removed support of `int[] Size` for CreateEffectWarhead, since I now realise it is a terrible idea to try and standardise it with the other three non-damage warheads.
If that functionality is needed, it would have to use range offsets rather than tiles, since an explosion can be non-centered.
